author: @pauladediosoliver7143
text: For any one who needs, I got an error when running sentiment_mod and it was because the feature set was not "pickled". After find_features function goes this code and it worked for me !   featuresets = [(find_features(rev), category) for (rev, category) in documents]  random.shuffle(featuresets) print(len(featuresets))  featuresets_txt =  open("pickled_algos/featuresets.pickle", "wb") #opening a featursets picle  testing_set = featuresets[10000:] training_set = featuresets[:10000] pickle.dump(featuresets,featuresets_txt) #dumpining into the pickle featuresets_txt.close() #closing the pickle

author: @maxbranco7321
text: # Only taught of doing this after manually doing all the pickling:    def pickle_stuff(stuff):     from pickle import dump     open_file = open(f"pickled_stuff/{stuff}.pickle", "wb")     dump(stuff, open_file)     open_file.close()   stuff_to_pickle = {      documents,     feature_sets,     word_features,      original_classifier,     NuSVC_classifier,     LinearSVC_classifier,     SVC_classifier,     SGDClassifier_classifier,     LogisticRegression_classifier,     BernoulliNB_classifier,     MNB_classifier    }  for s in stuff_to_pickle:      pickle_stuff(s)

text: Hey dude, thank you again for all the great videos!  Hey I forgot which video but I want to comment that Gaussian naive Bayes wouldn't work for our case. Becuase the assumption is that continuous values associated with each class are distributed according to a Gaussian distribution.
